alert.note: Alert for Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Union County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 19 at 2:39AM MST until January 21 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 8 inches except as high as 10 inches near the Colorado border. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass and northern portions of Union County. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes I-25 through Raton Pass. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of blowing snow could reduce visibility below one mile at times.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Union County
